titleStmt.title: The charters of London: or, The second part of Londons liberty in chaines discovered. In which by the ancient, rationall, and fundamentall charters of the famous City of London, is proved and declared, that it is the true and undeniable right of all and every the barons, burgesses, free-men, or commoners of London, to have their free vote in chusing out, annually from amongst themselves, a lord major, two sheriffes, and all their alder-men; ... with divers other things worth the knowledg of all the free-men, not only of London, but of all England. For whose good this is published by Lieut. Col: John Lilburn, prisoner in the Tower of London, for the common liberties of the kingdome against the usurpations of the House of Lords.
London's liberty in chains discovered. Part 2
titleStmt.author: Lilburne, John, 1614?-1657.

notesStmt.note: Includes several charters and other documents, as well as introductory and connecting text by Lilburne.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
